FuncDef:
The service-enhance slot command loads a GTL license file to a type-B board, allowing the board to support L3VPN and MVPN services.
The undo service-enhance slot command restores the default configuration.
Type-B boards include boards whose names contain -B.
To view a board name, run the display elabel command and view the Description field in the command output.
By default, a type-B board does not support L3VPN and MVPN services.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Type-B boards cannot support L3VPN or MVPN services without loading the GTL license file.
To configure L3VPN or MVPN services on these interface boards, you must buy a valid GTL license file and run the service-enhance slot command to load the license file to the interface board.
Prerequisites
Upload the GTL license file to the CF card of an MPU and run the license active command to activate the license.
Follow-up Procedure
Configure L3VPN and MVPN services on an interface board.
Precautions
The service-enhance slot command applies only to type-B boards. Other types of boards or unregistered boards do not support this command.
After you disable L3VPN or MVPN, L3PVN or MVPN services are not supported. Exercise caution when running the undo service-enhance slot command. After the GTL license file expires, buy a new valid GTL license file in time. Otherwise, L3VPN or MVPN services on boards may be influenced.
